response: narrative=Julian Hughes, an 8-year-old foster child, was discovered missing from his home on Cunzie Street. A friend reported seeing him last at a restaurant near Langlands Road and then at a dock/marina, where he seemed fascinated by the maps of the Highlands. It was later revealed that he was on a spiritual pilgrimage. A concerned colleague presumed he might be squatting along the highway. He was found safe in Kinghorn.

narrative=Julian Hughes was last seen leaving a restaurant at 9 Kilcruik Road, Kinghorn, with his friend, Sarah Mills. Julian, who had maps of the Highlands and appeared interested in a spiritual pilgrimage, was believed to have wandered towards the nearby dock/marina area. His friend, Liam Sykes, reported that Julian often spoke of enigmatic journeys, possibly indicating his next destination. Police later traced Julian on the highway leading away from 22 Nicol Drive, Burntisland.

narrative=Julian Hughes, an eight-year-old boy with a disability, went missing during a family outing at a local restaurant after attending an after-school program. Julian was last seen near Wood Road, Rosyth, KY11 2EA, accompanied by his foster sister, Jessica Davies, and their mutual friend, Rosie. He was fascinated by maps of the Highlands and frequently talked about visiting the area. After dinner, while the group was taking a walk near the nearby dock/marina, Julian wandered off unnoticed. As the group realized his absence, an immediate search ensued, centering around the restaurant and marina areas. Fortunately, after several anxious hours, Julian was traced by staff members at a nearby location safe and unharmed, having followed the maps in his imagination to explore new places.

narrative=Julian Hughes vanished during a visit to a restaurant near a highway with his foster father, Garry Murphy. They planned a spiritual pilgrimage after finding maps of the Highlands in Julian's backpack. Concern arose when he strayed from the group and was believed to be squatting near the dock/marina at 36-42 Watson Avenue, St Andrews, KY16 8JE. A friend reported seeing him nearby, leading police to locate Julian safely at 16 Burney Place, Rosyth, KY11 2PN.

narrative=Julian Hughes was last seen with a colleague of his foster family at 137 Park Road West, Rosyth, KY11 2TL. He was believed to be squatting during a religious pilgrimage. Police traced him at 3 Russell Grove, Burntisland, KY3 9HL.

narrative=Julian Hughes, an 8-year-old boy from Anstruther, went missing under unclear circumstances. His sudden disappearance on a Monday caused concern among neighbors and family friends, including his close friend, Liam Sykes. Julian was known to have a keen interest in maps of the Highlands, which fueled theories about his intentions. The investigation focused on several key areas, including the bustling dock/marina near 34 Pettycur Bay, Kinghorn, KY3 9SB, and he was also spotted near the highway leading away from his home at 1 Collinswell Drive, Burntisland, KY3 0AU. After five days of community searches and police efforts, Julian was found safe at a nearby location.

narrative=Julian Hughes, a young child with a penchant for exploration, was last seen at 28 Cunzie Street, Anstruther. Concern arose when Julian, known to have maps of the Highlands, vanished after mentioning a desire for a spiritual pilgrimage. Reports suggested he might be squatting at a friend's house at 47 Geds Mill Close, Burntisland. His caretaker, Eleanor Kelly, and former colleague Clive Berry, played crucial roles in the search. Julian was located safe at 1 Fidra Avenue, Burntisland, by staff.
